meanings.definition: A yellowish or brownish earth consisting of clay mixed with hydrated oxide of iron, and used as a pigment.
meanings.sent1: The artist used tutty to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The tutty added a warm tone to the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The children molded the tutty into various shapes during art class.
meanings.sent4: The tutty of creativity colored their imaginations.
meanings.sent5: The tutty pigment transformed the canvas into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A yellowish or brownish pigment obtained from this earth.
meanings.sent1: She mixed the tutty with water to make a vibrant paint.
meanings.sent2: The tutty pigment gave the wall a rustic look.
meanings.sent3: The tutty powder accidentally spilled all over the table.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the tutty on the palette.
meanings.sent5: The tutty hue brightened up the entire room.

meanings.sent1: The sunset painted the sky with a tutty glow.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had a lovely tutty shade.
meanings.sent3: The tutty of the leaves signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent4: His eyes sparkled with a tutty light.
meanings.sent5: The tutty of the sand reminded her of the beach.
